name: Blue Crab
funFact: Blue crabs can swim sideways and backwards! Their powerful claws can crack open oyster shells.

name: Hermit Crab
funFact: Hermit crabs wear empty shells as armor! When they outgrow their shell, they search for a bigger one.

name: King Crab
funFact: King crabs are giants! They can have a leg span of up to 6 feet and live for 30+ years.

name: Shore Crab
funFact: Shore crabs are master climbers! They can walk on vertical rocks and hide under stones.

name: Fiddler Crab
funFact: Male fiddler crabs have one giant claw! They wave it to attract mates and scare away rivals.

name: Ghost Crab
funFact: Ghost crabs are super fast runners! They can sprint at 10 mph and seem to disappear into the sand.

name: Spider Crab
diet: Omnivore - dead animals, plants, small fish
funFact: Spider crabs have the longest legs of any crab! Some can span up to 12 feet across.

name: Coconut Crab
size: Body up to 16 inches, leg span 3 feet
funFact: Coconut crabs are the largest land crabs! They can climb trees and crack coconuts with their claws.

name: Horseshoe Crab
funFact: Horseshoe crabs are living fossils! They've been around for 450 million years - older than dinosaurs!

name: Snow Crab
funFact: Snow crabs can survive in freezing water! They have special proteins that prevent their blood from freezing.

name: Mangrove Crab
funFact: Mangrove crabs are tree climbers! They can climb up to 6 feet high in mangrove trees.

name: Decorator Crab
funFact: Decorator crabs are fashionistas! They attach seaweeds and sponges to their shells for camouflage.

name: Robber Crab
size: Body up to 16 inches, leg span 3 feet
funFact: Robber crabs are excellent climbers! They can climb palm trees and steal coconuts from the top.

name: Pea Crab
diet: Filter feeder - food from host oyster
funFact: Pea crabs are tiny hitchhikers! They live inside oysters and mussels, eating the food their host filters.

name: Boxer Crab
funFact: Boxer crabs are martial artists! They hold sea anemones in their claws like boxing gloves for defense.
